For, speaking generally, the maxim you have often heard and read holds true-'tis far more disfiguring to lose, than to lack, men's praises

Pray believe, what l began by saying, that I have written as your monitor, not your preceptor, though l have played the preceptor also. For, to be sure, I am not afraid of carrying affection beyond its just limits: since there cannot be any danger of excess where we ought to advance as far as possible. Farewell.
